bibl.title: Letter from Mario G. Lebredo to Walter M. Daniel, December 22, 1923

div1.p: Lebredo states that the sick man from a steamship who was taken to Las Animas Hospital died of malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Mario G. Lebredo to Walter M. Daniel, December 22, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
T r a n s l a t i o n.
Republica de Cuba
Secretaria de Sanidad y Beneficencia
Direccion de Sanidad
Hospital “Las Animas”
Havana, December 22, 1923
Mr. Walter M. Daniel
Division Manager
United Fruit Company
H a v a n a.
Sir:
div1.p:
In reply to your communication No. 368, of December 20th, 1923, I
have the honor to inform you that the seaman from the S/S “Saramacca” named
James E. Roudabush, American, 37 years of age, to whom you refer, died of
Malaria, death certificate showing cause of death as due to “Accesopernicioso
Malarico”. This diagnosis was proven by an analysis of the blood, in which
was found, in great numbers, the malarial microbe of malignant type, and
many “gametos.”
